segments.text: I see the woman in the kitchen, apron on, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so engrossed, not looking up at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is full to the brim, water running over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why hasn't she noticed and turned it off?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is growing, wetting everything nearby.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are at the cabinet, boy on the shaky stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's dipping into the cookie jar like it's his own.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stealing snacks right under her nose is just rude.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's waiting eagerly, which makes it worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool could collapse any moment, spilling cookies everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden through the window is spotless, unlike this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I get mad thinking about the cleanup ahead.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: These hazards are unnecessary and frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR
